Package org.postgresql.pljava.sqlgen

Not strictly part of the API, this package contains the compiler extension itself that recognizes PL/Java annotations and generates the deployment descriptor.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Lexicals
    A few useful SQL lexical definitions supplied as Pattern objects.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    DDRProcessor
    Annotation processor invoked by the annotations framework in javac for annotations of type org.postgresql.pljava.annotation.*.
    DDRWriter
    Class for writing an SQLJ deployment descriptor file in proper form, given snippets of SQL code for deployment and undeployment that have already been arranged into a workable order.

Package org.postgresql.pljava.sqlgen Description

Not strictly part of the API, this package contains the compiler extension itself that recognizes PL/Java annotations and generates the deployment descriptor. It is part of this module so that the pljava-api jar will be all that is needed on the class path when compiling PL/Java code, even with annotations.

Limitation note: A Java bug introoduced in Java 7 required a workaround that was added here in pull #42. The workaround has a limitation: if you are compiling Java sources that also use other annotations and other annotation processors, and if those other processors can write new Java files and cause more than one round of compilation, they must not include org.postgresql.pljava.annotation annotations in those files. This code needs to find all such annotations in round 1.

If Oracle fixes the underlying bug, the limitation can be removed. Oracle's bug site suggests that won't happen until Java 9, if then.
